Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted

= a contraption made of rope or leather strips formed into a loose mesh, placed over or around the mouth of an animal to prevent it from biting or eating; ≈ used figuratively to denote a device that is to keep human beings from talking

Node.gloss: to be dumb|to be unable to speak
Node.definition: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= state in which someone refrains from speaking
= action by which humans or deities refrain from speaking, expressing themselves, or acting in response
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= state in which humans experience grief

Node.gloss: to grow worse|to increase (of someone's suffering)
Node.definition: = process by which a condition grows in intensity
literally: to be hot (of one's לֵב (לֵב) heart); hence: = state in which humans experience extreme anger
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans speaks softly for themselves as if thinking out load
= process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state of having reached the terminal point of an event
= the overall dimensions or capacity of an object
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= process by which humans exist in this world for a short time only
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= width of the palm of the hand, of the four fingers, unspread; equals about 8 centimetres or 3 inches; ≈ associated with relative shortness
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= the timespan that a human being is on this world
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
literally: to stand firm; hence: = state in which humans are alive and well
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= a dark figure cast on the ground or some surface by a body intercepting light as its likeness or representation; ≈ associated with the brevity of human life
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose

Node.gloss: to be in tumult|to be in uproar|to be loud
Node.definition: = action by which humans speak loudly, ≈ often associated with a lack of wisdom

Node.gloss: to heap up|to pile up|to store up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans pile up large quantities of objects in one place
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= action by which humans or groups defy an authority or a standard of behavior; by extension, can also refer to the punishment or guilt incurred from a trangression
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= an individual, nation, or land that is affected by efforts from others to arouse an emotion of shame in them ◄ by words or actions
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

Node.gloss: to be dumb|to be unable to speak
Node.definition: = to be unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a disease or sickness or wound ◄ caused by another person or sent from God or a deity ► to punish a person or nation for some wrong or disobedience
exact meaning unknown; possibly: = an act of aggression
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: to be finished; hence: = process by which humans feel physically weak as a result of hardship or a deeply felt wish for something to happen
= action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution
literally: to cause to melt; hence: = causative process by which deities cause people or objects to vanish from existence

= smallish brown or gray moth that lays eggs in clothing or other cloth; eggs hatch into very small caterpillars, which feed on the fibers; ◄ Tineidae family, probably Tineola biselliella; ≈ symbols of decay, ruin, and slow destruction
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object
= particle marking a constituent as prominent, as if limiting the focus to a restricted number of entities
= state in which a condition does not serve any purpose
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= action by which someone purposely refrains from responding, either with words or with actions

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= indirect male progenitor
= process by which a flash of light appears and brightens up the surrounding world; ≈ associated with joy and suddenness
= a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time
= process by which someone is going to die, described as a movement in one way only

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
